headline: Wisconsin Republican Ron Johnson to run for re-election to Senate, reversing self-imposed term-limit vow
author: Associated Press

MADISON, Wis. (AP)  Republican U.S. Sen. Ron Johnson, one of former President Donald Trump's most ardent backers, announced Sunday that he will seek re-election in battleground Wisconsin, breaking his promise not to seek a third term.

But Johnson rescinded the pledge in the lead-up to announcing his re-election bid, saying circumstances have changed after Democrats won the White House and control of Congress.
Johnson over the past year has been a leading voice in downplaying the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot and the coronavirus pandemic, in addition to remaining a vocal Trump supporter.
Johnson announced his decision via email two days after a pair of Republicans with knowledge of his decision told the Associated Press that he was close to launching a bid.
Johnson, who contracted COVID-19 in October 2020 and reportedly is not vaccinated, has cast doubt over the efficacy of vaccines and pushed for unproven treatments.
